page.title: 06LIVING NEAR ARUNDEL PARK
page.content: The house, converted from two cottages beside a gateway to Arundel Park is accessible by car by a long lane from the cul-de-sac road between Arundel and South Stoke. The house belongs to the Norfolk Estates and a relation of the Duke of Norfolk lives there with her husband and four children. They are in residence for about five or six months of the year, which includes school holidays and weekend visits. The husband then commutes to London. The house is served by electricity, propane gas, an aga and septic tank drainage. Milk is collected at the end of the lane, the postman calls in a van. Shopping is done by car in Arundel and also brought from London. The family loves living in isolation, with the sights and sounds of nature but deplore trippers who spoil their peace.
